required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pharmacokinetic Study to Assess Dose Proportionality, Safety and Tolerability of Diazepam Nasal Spray in Healthy Adult Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Period, Randomized, Open-Label, Crossover Pharmacokinetic Study to Assess Dose Proportionality, Safety and Tolerability of Diazepam Nasal Spray in Healthy Adult Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, two-period, randomized, open-label, crossover pharmacokinetic (PK) study in healthy adult volunteers to evaluate dose proportionality of diazepam nasal spray using two dose levels

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes prior to dosing and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration curve from time 0 to the concentration at 24 hours (AUC0-24)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes prior to dosing and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration curve from time 0 to infinity (AUCinf)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes prior to dosing and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent total body clearance of drug from plasma (CL/F)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes prior to dosing and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events (AEs) including serious AEs

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 minutes prior to dosing and at specified time points up to 24 hours post-dose
from 5 minutes up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: If patient reports a change in taste associated with diazepam nasal spray, questionnaire to be completed by research staff.

arm_group.description: Each subject will receive two single doses of investigational product (DL1, DL2) with a 14-day washout between the doses. The order in which the doses are administered will be randomized, with subjects assigned to 1 of 2 treatment sequences: DL1 (A) followed by DL2 (B), or the reverse order (BA).

Each subject will receive two single doses of investigational product (DL1, DL2) with a 14-day washout between the doses. The order in which the doses are administered will be randomized, with subjects assigned to 1 of 2 treatment sequences: DL1 (A) followed by DL2 (B), or the reverse order (BA).

intervention.description: diazepam nasal spray at two dose levels (DL). One dose of diazepam nasal spray is administered as two intranasal sprays; one in each nostril using a nasal spray device.
